abstract.p: Fortis, Belgian financial products company, pays 3.3 billion euros, or about $2.9 billion, to acquire 80 percent of Dutch insurer ASR Verzekeringroep that it does not already own (S)

block.p: To gird against hostile takeover attempts, Fortis, the Belgian financial products company, agreed to pay 3.3 billion euros, or about $2.9 billion, to acquire the 80 percent of the Dutch insurer ASR Verzekeringsgroep that it does not own. Europe's insurance industry is consolidating, as insurers profit from increased investment by Europeans supplementing government pensions, and insurers in smaller European markets have been frequent takeover targets. Shares in ASR rose 51.9 percent, to 98.80 euros, while Fortis shares declined 7.4 percent, to 32.36 euros, on concerns the price paid was excessive.
